byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: White House Memo; Secret Service has been testing variety of improvements to fence surrounding White House, task made an urgent priority after intruder climbed fence in September 2014; implementation of new design will take many months due to fact that at least dozen government agencies and organizations have competing requirements, ranging from aesthetics to safety for visitors.
lead_paragraph: As the White House fence is altered to boost security, the Secret Service must balance a design that thwarts intruders but that doesn’t introduce a prison or Soviet style.

headline.main: Wanted at the White House: A Fence That Says Halt! (With Curb Appeal)
headline.print_headline: Wanted: A Fence That Says Halt! (But With Curb Appeal)

snippet: As the White House fence is altered to boost security, the Secret Service must balance a design that thwarts intruders but that doesn’t introduce a prison or Soviet style.
